comments.body: Should this be bytes so we get a byte string back?

No, but `to_bytes` should be used on the path being passed to `os.path.exists` -- I'll fix that.

The other functions accepting `path` already handle the conversion.

I have another change in progress that uses an abstraction over the `os` functions to handle all the encoding in one place, so eventually the need for calling `to_bytes` manually for `os` functions will go away.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +132,136 @@        The private key is cached across ansible-test invocations so it is only generated and published once per CI job.
        """
        path = os.path.expanduser('~/.ansible-core-ci-private.key')

        if os.path.exists(to_bytes(path)):
